ul.li1: 1The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet saw.
2O Yahweh, how long shall I cry for help
ul.li2: and you will not listen?
ul.li1: How long will I cry out to you, “Violence!”
ul.li2: and you will not save?
ul.li1: 3Why do you cause me to see evil
ul.li2: while you look at trouble?
ul.li1: Destruction and violence happen before me;
ul.li2: contention and strife arise.
ul.li1: 4Therefore the law is paralyzed,
ul.li2: and justice does not go forth perpetually.Or “forever”
ul.li1: For the wicked surround the righteous;
ul.li2: therefore justice goes forth perverted.

ul.li1: 5“Look among the nations and see;
ul.li2: be astonished and astounded.
ul.li1: For a work is about to be done in your days
ul.li2: that you will not believe if it is told.
ul.li1: 6For look! I am raising up the Chaldeans,
ul.li2: the bitter and impetuous nation,
ul.li1: the one who walks through the spacious places of earth
ul.li2: to take possession of dwellings not belonging to it.Or “him”
ul.li1: 7TheyHebrew “He” are dreadful and awesome;
ul.li2: theirHebrew “his” justice and theirHebrew “his” dignity proceed from themselves.Hebrew “him”
ul.li1: 8TheirHebrew “His” horses are more swift than leopards;
ul.li2: they are more menacing than wolves at dusk.
ul.li1: TheirHebrew “His” horsemen gallop; theirHebrew “his” horsemen come from afar;
ul.li2: they fly like an eagle that is swift to devour.
ul.li1: 9All of themHebrew “him” come for violence,
ul.li2: their faces pressing forward.
They gather captives like the sand.
ul.li1: 10And they themselves scoff at kings
ul.li2: and rulers are a joke to them.
ul.li1: They laugh at every fortification,
ul.li2: and they heap up earth and take it.
ul.li1: 11Then they sweep like the wind and pass on;
ul.li2: they become guilty, whose might is theirHebrew “his” god!”

ul.li1: 12Are you not from of old,
ul.li2: O Yahweh my God, my Holy One?
YouHebrew “we shall not die,” considered a deliberate scribal change of the text to avoid offensive language toward Yahweh shall not die.
ul.li1: O Yahweh, you have marked themHebrew “him” for judgment;
ul.li2: O Rock, you have established themHebrew “him” for reproof.
ul.li1: 13Your eyes are too pure to see evil,
ul.li2: and you are not able to look at wrongdoing.Or “trouble”
ul.li1: Why do you look at the treacherous?
Why are you silent when the wicked swallows up
ul.li2: someone more righteous than him?
ul.li1: 14You make humankind like fish of the sea,
ul.li2: like crawling creatures that have no ruler among them.
ul.li1: 15He brings up all of them with a fishhook;
ul.li2: he drags them up with a fishnet;
ul.li1: he gathers them in his dragnet.
ul.li2: Therefore, he rejoices and exults.
ul.li1: 16Therefore he sacrifices to his fishnet
ul.li2: and makes offerings to his dragnet,
ul.li1: for by them he makes a good livingLiterally “his portion is fat”
ul.li2: and his food is rich.
ul.li1: 17Will he therefore empty his fishnet
ul.li2: and continually kill nations without showing mercy?
